title.bibl: De Forenede Staters Danske Almanak, 1914, p. 61. [The Danish Consulate in Chicago]

div.bibl: De Forenede Staters Danske Almanak, 1914, p. 61. [THE DANISH CONSULATE IN CHICAGO]

body.p: The Danish consul in Chicago is George Bech, who was appointed in 1908. He is paid by the Danish state. His office is at 154 West Randolph Street, Room 79.

Under the Chicago office are ten vice-consulates [having jurisdiction] in the following states: Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Iowa, Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Colorado, Montana, North and South Dakota, Utah, and Wyoming.
